title: feat(appset): add webhook support for SCM generator for GitHub and Azure DevOps
body:
Closes #15591

Adds webhook support for SCM generator. Currently only added for GitHub, which will be triggered from the repository webhook event and Azure DevOps, which will be triggered from the push event.

title: fix: Set backend-protocol=HTTPS for ingress-nginx in SSL-Passthrough mode
body:
While following the Ingress-nginx - Option 1. SSL Passthrough article[1] I've encountered **HTTP 429 Too Many Requests** error. I've noticed that there is no backend specification which I use elsewhere and which solved the issue for me.

[1]: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/ingress/#option-1-ssl-passthrough

title: feat(appset): Support various merge strategies for merge generator
body:
Support for various merge strategies in merge generator. Includes: 
`left-join`, `left-join-uniq`, `inner-join`, `inner-join-uniq`, `full-join`, `full-join-uniq`

This PR also allows more than one parameter sets to have the same merge key in the base generator

Fixes #11952, #12837, #14560

title: feat: A way to display the diff of resource hooks
body:
Signed-off-by: toyamagu-2021 <toyamagu2021@gmail.com>

## Motivations

* Takve over #6030 

> PR for add an option to display resource hooks in the cli command argocd app diff.
> Because there are few case to compare target resource hooks and live state, include-resource-hook option is limited when comparing to a local manifests or particular revision.

Closes #5979
Closes #6030 

In addition to that, our company uses `PreSync` hook to operate db, so we must compare Job and ConfigMap manifests carefully.

## Modifications

* Add `--include-resource-hook` option to CLI.
* When calling `ManagedResources`, I add `IncludeResourceHook` query option to get hooked resources and compare them with the generated manifest.

## Verifications

Sample outputs is following:

```console
(⎈|kind-kind:argocd-e2e)➜  e2e git:(feat-5979) ✗ ../../dist/argocd app diff test-hook-diff-with-resource-hook --include-resource-hook --revision HEAD --plaintext --server localhost:8080 --auth-token {...}
```

```diff
===== /Pod argocd-e2e--test-hook-diff-with-resource-hook-ezjdu/hook ======
89c89
<     - "true"
---
>     - "false"
```

title: fix: goroutine leaks. And don't execute defer in for loops
body:
https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/blob/f8f9ae9accd413b417be1d188418f2b3b7c25e63/server/application/application.go#L1654

`done` is an unbuffered channel. if the current context ends, then it may cause the goroutine to not exit correctly.

https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/blob/f8f9ae9accd413b417be1d188418f2b3b7c25e63/reposerver/repository/repository.go#L750

If you are allocating resources in a loop, you should not simply use defer, because then the resources will not be released as early (at the end of each iteration), but only after the for statement (after all iterations).

title: fix: ProjectWindows update always setting UTC as timezone
body:
Fixes an issue where UTC would be autoset as timezone.

How to reproduce (you can see the timezone in the default list in my other PR #15929 😃 or just use -o yaml) :
```
# Make a project window with a timezone
argocd proj windows add PROJECT \
    --kind allow \
    --schedule "0 22 * * *" \
    --duration 1h \
    --applications "*" \
    --time-zone EST
  
# check the timezone
argocd proj windows list PROJECT -o yaml

# update something else
argocd proj windows update PROJECT ID --duration 50m

# timezone is in UTC now
argocd proj windows list PROJECT -o yaml
```

With these changes, this flow should now work

title: feat(appset): get latest protected tag from gitlab api
body:
Hello everyone!
This Pull Request add feature to get latest protected tag from GitLab API for SCM provider to use it with ApplicationSet.
In our company we are using simple GitFlow to deploy our applications. It means that we have 3 stages (review/stage/production). On the last stage of deploying we use lastest protected tag in gitlab to deploy our application to production.
We want to use ApplicationSet but without tags it will be not possible to implement it in our GitFlow.
What do you think about this PR? It it possible to have it in the future release or could someone do it in better way?

I have tested it locally and in our test ArgoCD installation. It works great.

title: fix: Set gpg-wrapper.sh permissions in image (#15819)
body:
Fixes #15819.

Set execution permission for hack/gpg.wrapper.sh and other in-repo shell scripts explicitly in Dockerfile for Argo CD image. This prevents the failure of an installation with a locally built image due to permission variations in the dev environment.

I locally verified that all Argo CD `Pod`s from the resulting image no longer crash loop.

title: fix(action): create job should use random hex
body:
The initial version uses a timestamp w/ minute granularity, in order to test #15577, I tried creating two jobs within the same minute and got an annoying error message. The google cloud implementation uses `-manual-xxxxx` as a suffix instead of a time stamp which feels more in keeping w/ k8s style. I've chosen to use `-manual-xxxxxx` (one more `x`) so that it's possible to distinguish the two generators but still keeping the same general pattern.

title: feat(webhook): make app refresh operation concurrent (#14269)
body:
The current webhook handler processes all applications sequentially, with each iteration potentially calling the network-bound argo.RefreshApp() which calls k8s API to patch a refresh annotation. This makes webhook slow in scenarios involving hundreds of apps.

This PR introduces concurrent application processing to webhook HandleEvent(). We also expose a new configurable setting  in ArgoCD CM`webhook.maxConcurrentAppRefresh` to be able to control the degree of concurrency.

Fixes https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/issues/14269

title: feat(appset): add progressive sync strategy CRDS
body:
<!--
Note on DCO:

If the DCO action in the integration test fails, one or more of your commits are not signed off. Please click on the *Details* link next to the DCO action for instructions on how to resolve this.
-->
As discussed in https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/issues/14458, adds new CRDs to define sync strategies that can be referenced and used by multiple ApplicationSets.

`SyncStrategy` is a namespaced resource and needs to be in the same namespace as the ApplicationSet referencing it.

`ClusterSyncStrategy` is a cluster-wide SyncStrategy that can be referenced by ApplicationSets from any namespace.

Closes #14458

body:
Closes #15164

I suppose the errors were ignored earlier because diff utilities usually exit with a non-zero code if diff is present. I'm not really proficient with golang, I hope I've handled it in the right way but please take a look.

argocd app diff efs-csi-driver

===== /ServiceAccount kube-system/efs-csi-controller-sa ======
FATA[0001] exec: "abcd": executable file not found in $PATH

title: fix(controller): app stuck in wrong status (#14266)
body: Fixes https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/issues/14266 The fix is currently causing the app not to update properly in the UI. When removing pod, the app status is now correctly updated, but the level 0 refreshes happening on pod update do not update the UI. By looking at the code the update to the AppTree cache should notify the argocd-server. Either pods are not in the AppTree (because they are not a managed resources) so there is no update or there is a bug in the notification system. Refreshing the web browser fixes the issue so it seems to be another bug causing this. I do think that having the resource updated with the correct value is more important than the UI refresh, so it should not be a blocker for the PR. title: feat(14638): Set managed-by label on installed resources (Alpha)
body:
Note on DCO:

If the DCO action in the integration test fails, one or more of your commits are not signed off. Please click on the *Details* link next to the DCO action for instructions on how to resolve this.

- Closes https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/issues/14638
- Created argocd resources did not have `app.kubernetes.io/managed-by` label set. Kubernetes [recommends](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/common-labels/) having multiple labels on resources, one of which is the `managed-by` label. If the new resource does not have the label set, it should now default to `argocd`.

title: fix: process ssh_url and http_url when receiving a webhook from GitLab  #7657
body:
This is a quick fix for processing Gitlab webhooks when the `ssh_url` or `http_url` is different from the `web_url` and the automated matching fails in `getWebUrlRegex()`.

E.g. Gitlab UI is reachable via subpath like `mydomain.com/gitlab/group/repo` but the ssh access is available as `mydomain.com:2222/group/repo` so the subpath `/gitlab/` part is missing.

I've tested it locally and it now correctly triggers app sync when the webhook is received. Before the fix, the webhook was just ignored.
Please note: While the webhook is logged 3 times, once for each URL, the app refresh is triggered only once.

Fixes: [#7657](https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/issues/7657)

title: feat(make): TARGET_ARCH By default, compile your own arch image
body:
I think that when no parameters are provided, the arch that comes with the system should be compiled by default, which is in the form of uname -m

## for example
 to use your local architecture

`make image`

to use amd64 explicitly, no matter your local architecture:

`TARGET_ARCH="linux/amd64" make image`

to use arm64 explicitly, no matter your local architecture:

`TARGET_ARCH="linux/arm64" make image`

title: fix(appset): Fix AppSet Webhook for gitlab merge requests (#13766)
body:
Closes [#13766]
When using gitlab for the PullRequestGenerator, the webhook doesn't refresh the appset.

When I looked into the code, I noticed that the webhook for PullRequestGenerator for gitlab tries to match the project id with the name.
This fix changes the code so it correctly matches the path/name of the project with the path/name set up in the PullRequestGenerator.

title: feat: Enables headless sso auth for argocd CLI #14231
body:
# Summary 

This PR addresses the enhancement purposed in #14231. It utilizes the already imported `github.com/skratchdot/open-golang/open` to allow for more graceful error handling. This error is reported to stdout, and if the user is port forwarding `8085` (the default but this  also depends on client config with oauth vendor), open successful SSO will complete the PKCE auth flow.

Closes [ISSUE #14231]

title: chore: support running dockerized toolchain in rootless mode
body:
When running in rootless mode, the containers must run as "root", which is mapped to the current user. This avoids permission issues with the various bind mounts during development.

This simply adds a `ROOTLESS` variable to the `Makefile` allowing that and documents it.

title: fix(ui): search bar improvements
body:
In the current version of the UI I have found two problems:
1. It was impossible to reset a focus from the input field by pressing Escape button
2. It was impossible to clear input field from a payload correctly. It was needed to click on the "clear button" twice (at first input field would shrink down and only then it could be cleared).
![Screenshot from 2023-06-11 14-58-53](https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/assets/69901624/5133b8b2-b4d4-4bc5-8617-3eb95ea0a641)

So I decided to add additional handling of Escape and changed behaviour of "clear button" a little bit.

title: chore: (Issue 13617) Allow building the image in an environment with custom CA certificates
body:
…custom CA certificates.

Setting `NODE_OPTIONS=--use-openssl-ca` allows us to run the following build command locally on a corporate network using ZScaler (for example): 
```
docker buildx build --platform linux/amd64 -t argoproj/argocd:latest . -v /etc/ssl:/etc/ssl -v /usr/local/share/ca-certificates:/usr/local/share/ca-certificates -v /usr/share/ca-certificates:/usr/share/ca-certificates
```

Fixes [ISSUE #13617]

title: fix(metrics): Unify metrics endpoints with dedicated metrics Service
body:
Resolves:
- https://github.com/argoproj/argo-helm/issues/2035

It seems that over time the manifests are not consistent for metrics collection therefore I tried to unify all manifests:
- drop metrics ports from normal Services.  
  This ensures that no metrics endpoint is available on normal service so metrics are not unintentionally published (e.g. some setups [like AWS ALB] need `NodePort` service type)
- create new dedicated Services for the metrics ports (suffix all services with `-metrics`)
- update the dashboards (job label equals service names)

Open questions:
- should we also migrate **notification** and **server** metrics service to `clusterIP: None`?  
  This would be a breaking change as the field `clusterIP` is immutable for existing Services.

---

title: fix: data race for lazy OIDC provider initialization
body:
The ArgoCD server SSO configuration is shared state that gets potentially concurrently read and written to.  We are protecting it with an RWMutex to prevent the data race.  Since it's write-once and the read path is much more common, and there should be no contention.

title: feat: Allow passing entirety of OIDC config in a secret [#13172]
body:
Fixes #13172 

I want to be able to inject a secret into the namespace to configure all of argocd-cm's oidc.config, not only the client id & secret.

This change will make it easier to automate bootstrapping argo-cd-enabled multi-cluster setups across various cloud accounts by allowing us to generate both the OIDC provider for each account and a secret that will configure how each ArgoCD instance connects with its account's provider. For a more complete explanation of the motivation, see #13172.

This feature should be stable as it does not introduce any radically new changes or uncovered logical branches, but happy to mark it however the maintainers think best.

title: fix(health): route health check stuck in 'Progressing' (#10037)
body:
There was already a PR which tries to fix that the Openshift route health check stuck in 'Progressing' (#8170). But there is still a case when this current implementation of the healthcheck does not work:

``` yaml
status:
  ingress:
    - conditions:
        - lastTransitionTime: '2023-03-24T07:58:05Z'
          status: 'True'
          type: Admitted
        - message: xxx successfully claimed in Infoblox
          reason: ClaimedInInfoblox
          status: 'True'
          type: Admitted
      host: xxx
      routerCanonicalHostname: xxx
      routerName: default
      wildcardPolicy: None
```

As you can see there are two conditions with `type: Admitted` and `status: 'True'` which results that the counter `numTrue` will be greater than `numIngressRules`. But the current health check wants an equals to (https://github.com/argoproj/argo-cd/blob/master/resource_customizations/route.openshift.io/Route/health.lua#L20).
It can be simple fix if we make the `==` to `>=`.  

Fixes #10037

Closes #12849

## Some Notes

This PR changes more than it absolutely needs to, I'm aware. But during debugging and figuring out where to fix this, I got confused regarding what's a parameter(s), parameter sets and lists of those. So I decided to rename those and document this intent via the type aliases.

Additionally, I think pulling out id computation and indexing is helping in separation of concerns here. The more linear flow in `GenerateParams` is IMHO more easy to understand, having blocks of logic split out into their own functions.

Feel free to let me know, if this doesn't fit the projects style, I'm new to this :grin: .
Greets,
Chris
